alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 12 at 1:39PM PDT until June 16 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor tidal overflow of beaches and exposed parking lots around the time of high tide. * WHERE...Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...From Monday evening through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest tide of 7.3 to 7.4 feet will occur each evening from Monday through Wednesday between 850 pm and 1030 pm PDT.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
